dialogues.text: Formally known as Camp Rolling Hills. Upperstate New York September.

dialogues.speaker: TAWNY RICHARDS
dialogues.text: a pretty woman in her mid 30's, smiling directly into the Tawny wears an expensive, coordinated outfit. She holds a microphone with a WMGH logo.

dialogues.speaker: TAWNY
dialogues.text: Hi. I'm Tawny Richards with the WMGH newsteam. We're at Camp New Horizons, where an autumn retreat called "An experiment in Sharing" is about to begin. Let's meet the owners of the camp, Herman and Lilly Miranda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tawny and her ASSORTED TELEVISION CREW cross to HERMAN AN MIRANDA, who stand beneath a large banner saying "AN EXPE IN SHARING - CAMP NEW HORIZONS." Lilly, short and somewha is in her mid 40's. Herman, about two inches shorter than seems a few years older. Both wear Camp New Horizons t-s Herman also sports tight jeans, boots, and a belt with a Playboy insignia on the buckle. Lilly wears flowery short sandals. On either side of Herman and Lilly stand TWO GROUPS OF TE who we will meet in a moment. The first group looks very affluent; the other group looks poor and streetwise. Ange the latter group, stands a bit off to the side of them. S dressed as we saw her this morning. Herman gives his best smile to Tawny as Lilly stares into WMGH camera.

dialogues.speaker: TAWNY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Herman, tell us about this wonderfully unique program.

dialogues.speaker: HERMAN

dialogues.speaker: TAWNY

dialogues.speaker: TAWNY
dialogues.text: Ironically, Camp New Horizons was formerly known as Camp Rolling Hills, where last year nineteen people were brutally slain by alleged psychopath Angela Baker. dialogues.speaker: ANGELA

Barney carries a large box full of various camping items.

dialogues.text: I know I'm bending the rules a bit, but hey -

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: God. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY

dialogues.text: as SOMETHING leaps out.

dialogues.text: Then looks. Realizes.

dialogues.text: It looks at Tony and Marsha then scampers back into the w

dialogues.text: Riff! Stop it! Stop it right now or I'll get Officer Whitmore! Riff lets go. Cindy, crying, runs into her tent. Everyone silent. Then:

Marsha then hands the clean utensils to Anita, who d them. Barney in the b.g. picks up a pile of wood, crosses campers and sets it down.

dialogues.text: Nobody knows. There's no pictures of her since 7 years ago. Plus when she was 18 her juvenile records were destroyed. All we can go on are descriptions.

dialogues.text: She's white. About 5 foot 7, 115 pounds. Brown eyes. Reddish brown hair. Twenty-one years old.

dialogues.text: What would you do if you saw her? Pause.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: (matter of factly) I'd kill her.

dialogues.text: All right, everyone. Let's put our differences aside and try to move on,

Angela keeps walking, unaware tha has stopped. Angela bumps into a tree. Cindy LAUGHS and catches up to

dialogues.text: Hey -

dialogues.text: SIGHING, she sits down and pulls a gold cigarette case ou jeans. She opens up the case, takes out a cigarette and l it. Cindy inhales the cigarette as if it were the last sh ever smoke.

dialogues.text: as it approaches Angela.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA

dialogues.speaker: CINDY, (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: CINDY, (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: CINDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (mimicking Angela) Help! Somethin's on Me! Her face begins to lift out of frame.

dialogues.speaker: CINDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (confused) Hey -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angela begins hoisting Cindy up the flagpole.

dialogues.speaker: WHAT'S GOIN' ON
dialogues.text: Angela, ignoring her, turns Cindy around so Cindy's head the ground. Angela then reaches up and wraps the rope aro of Cindy's legs.

dialogues.speaker: EVERYTHING YOU'VE GOT
dialogues.text: Angela starts hoisting her up again.

dialogues.speaker: TO ME
dialogues.text: Angela hoists her to the top of the flagpole.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: Because you're a cheerleader, a fornicator, a drug-taker, and a nasty, snotty bigot. Besides that, you're real nice. Angela lets go of the rope. Cindy drops to the bottom. Her head SMASHES into the cement surrounding the flagpole

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lilly cooks a larger juicy steak as Angela enters.

dialogues.speaker: LILLY
dialogues.text: Where's Cindy?

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: At the main camp. She's got a headache.

dialogues.speaker: LILLY
dialogues.text: Why don't you be a dear and get her? While you're at it, grab that sack of garbage by my tent. There's a place to dump it behind the dining hall. Ancela crosses to the garbage and picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: LILLY
dialogues.text: Oh - I'm just about out of tanning lotion. There's some in the pantry right next to the kitchen. The front door should be open.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: Did there used to be a cabin up here?

dialogues.speaker: LILLY
dialogues.text: Yes. Right over there.  She points to the pile of boards.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: Was that the cabin where all those bodies were found last year?

dialogues.speaker: LILLY
dialogues.text: (surprised) How'd you know about that?

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: I guess I read about it.

dialogues.speaker: LILLY
dialogues.text: Well, don't tell the others. They could get spooked. Angela starts to exit.

dialogues.speaker: LILLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And hurry back. It's almost time for lunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angela lifts up the doormat, finds the key and opens the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angela enters, carrying the bag of garbage. She stops and looks at the empty hall.

dialogues.speaker: FANTASY FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: Angela's flashbacks, like all memories, have been changed and wishful thinking. Angela seems prettier and more vibr we knew her to be. The CAMPERS in her memories are also m excited and cheerful than they actually were.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: in a Camp Rolling Hills t-shirt. Very happy as she stands in front of the CROWDED dining h

dialogues.text: Good morning, Campers!

dialogues.speaker: CAMPERS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (shouting) Good morning, Angela!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a wonderful day to be alive, isn't it?!

dialogues.speaker: CAMPERS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (shouting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angela turns and continues walking.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: with her guitar, SINGING THE "HAPPY CAMPER SONG" with the CAMPERS, who enthusiastically CLAP as they sing.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA AND CAMPERS
dialogues.text: (singing) Oh, I'm a Happy Camper! I love the summer sun, I love the trees and forests, I'm always having fun!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now by the kitchen entrancer Angela stops and looks back more.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: her "Counselor of the Week" ribbon pinned to her chest. H the ribbon is slightly bigger and prettier than it actual Angela brushes away a tear before she addresses the campe

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: As some of you know, I've gone through a lot of hard times in my life. I've been picked on.  Abused. And misunderstood more often than I can remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: listening. They clearly love and respect her.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA, (CONT'D, 0.S.)
dialogues.text: But that's what so terrific about places like this. We can learn to love one another.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thanks for being such great kids. You've made this camp so much fun. I love you all. Everyone CHEERS as Angela smiles, laughs, and begins to c

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: You like me! You really, really like me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angela smiles and turns toward the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PITCH BLACK until Angela opens the CREAKING DOOR and turn light. A MOUSE scurries across the floor. Angela slowly enters. it is obvious that the pantry, almo empty of supplies, is in dire neglect. Angela passes by a shelf containing old sports equipment preservers. Much of the equipment is damaged. Angela spots a bottle of sun tan lotion next to a cassett recorder in the "lost and found" section. Next to the tap recorder is a microphone and several tapes. Angela picks up the lotion, then wipes her finger across of the tape recorder. Angela looks at her finger. It's co with dirt and dust. A COCKROACH runs past hez hand. Angela SCREAMS and jumps back. She quickly crosses back t entrance. Hanging on a nail next to the light switch is a key ring with several keys.  Angela looks at the keys a moment. Then takes them.

dialogues.text: Angela exits the dining hall's back door and the bag of g She looks for garbage cans, but there are none. Crossing a few feet from the back entrance, she spots a g pit about 4 feet wide. Next to it is a large pile of dirt shovel lays on top. Angela crosses to the pit and looks inside.

dialogues.text: About 5 1/2 feet deep. SEVERAL RATS gnaw away at the rott garbage.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: as she quickly throws the trash in the pit, and turns awa

dialogues.text: No. She's resting awhile in one of the cabins.

dialogues.text: I thought it was time to eat.

dialogues.text: I want you two to stand next to each other, side by side. They comply, and Lilly begins tying a rope around their w As she does:

dialogues.speaker: LILLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm going to be tying you two together. You'll have to coordinate your walking, your hand movements, everything. Lilly starts tying the wrists of their inner hands togeth she turns to Riff.

dialogues.speaker: LILLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Riff, since Cindy isn't feeling well, I think you and I will have to be partners.

dialogues.speaker: RIFF
dialogues.text: No fucken way. Lilly lets it pass. Never argue with a juvenile delinquen

dialogues.text: How long do we have to do this?

dialogues.speaker: LILLY
dialogues.text: Until you've caught enough fish for lunch and dinner. It'll test how well you can work together.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: But what about that steak you were cooking? Lilly starts tying their inner calves together.

dialogues.speaker: LILLY
dialogues.text: That was mine. I'm allergic' to fish.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: Staring angrily at Lilly.

dialogues.text: Angela and Bobby, tied together, sit on the dock, next to are their fishing supplies.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: Gimme the hook. Bobby does. Angela quickly baits the hook.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: You're good at that.

dialogues.text: That's what everybody says. Okay, cast. Bobby does his best, but it's not too great. Angela decid let it be. She turns to Bobby.

dialogues.text: Why'd you come here?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: It's a once-in-a-lifetime experience. Plus it looks great on my resume. He motions to the fishing pole.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Could you hold this a minute?

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: Sure. He gives her the fishing pole. Then turns toward her. And

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I think you're nice.

dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Do you think I'm nice?

dialogues.text: Yeah. I guess.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Good.  Beat.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY, (CON'D)

dialogues.text: I like being tied up. Especially next to you. It turns me on. Angela tries not to look nauseated. Just as she is about to say something, Bobby attacks her, kissing her and fondling her breasts with his free hand. Angela drops the pole and slaps Bobby hard.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: But I thought you wanted it. Your type always do.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: No! Pause.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: At least not now. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA, (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: LILLY
dialogues.text: lying on the recliner - eyes closed, sunning herself. A string of fish are shoved in front of her face. She frowns, then opens her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angela, still tied to Bobby, holds the fish.

dialogues.speaker: LILLY
dialogues.text: Good job! (beat) Why don't you put them down? Angela complies. Lilly gets out of her chair and begins t them. Lilly turns to a tent occupied by Riff. As dsual, his RAP blares in the b.g.

dialogues.speaker: LILLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Riff! Since Maria and Bobby caught the fish, I think you should clean them. No answer. Lilly turns back to Angela and Bobby.

dialogues.speaker: LILLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Bobby, maybe you should clean them.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: But that's not fair. He doesn't do anything.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: Let me talk to him. She crosses to the tent and opens the flap. Riff, hands b his head, lies on his sleeping bag.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hi. Riff doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We just spent two hours catching fish. It's only fair that you clean them. RTFF TURNS UP HIS MUSIC FULL BLAST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please turn that down.

dialogues.speaker: RIFF
dialogues.text: What? ANGELA (shouting) I said turn down your music.

dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: (shouting) You heard me the first time! Riff looks at her a moment. Turns down his music. Then pu pistol from behind his head and points it at her. Angela turns to Bobby.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Clean the fish, Bobby.

dialogues.text: Marsha her hands tied and her eyes blindfolded, is led by through the woods.

dialogues.text: This is easy. Make it harder.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Okay. He grabs her shoulders and starts leading her around, alm bumping her into several trees. She loves it. Tony then s spinning her around.

dialogues.text: Stop it! I'm getting dizzy! Tony stops. Marsha wobbles to the ground. He sits next to

dialogues.speaker: MARSHA
dialogues.text: It's your turn.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Huh uh.

dialogues.speaker: MARSHA
dialogues.text: I'll tell!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geez. I'm scared. He unties her, and takes off her blindfold.

dialogues.speaker: TONY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So what's it like where you live? AS MARSHA STARTS TO SPEAK, Tony playfully interrupts.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: No. Don't tell me. You go toa little red brick school. And you're in the choir.

dialogues.speaker: MARSHA
dialogues.text: It's orange brick. And I'm in the band.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Same difference. You've got really nice parents. And your town has a park where every Fourth of July there's fireworks. Plus at Christmas there's a big parade when Santa Claus arrives. Am I right?

dialogues.speaker: MARSHA
dialogues.text: Don't make fun of me!

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: And what have you been doing to me this whole weekend? MARSHA LAUGHS.

dialogues.speaker: MARSHA
dialogues.text: Are you in a gang?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Where I'm from, everybody is.

dialogues.speaker: MARSHA
dialogues.text: What's it like?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: You don't want to hear about it. I wish I could get out. But the only way to do that is to move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Maybe I will. I'll come live with you. In Idaho.

dialogues.speaker: MARSHA
dialogues.text: Ohio.

dialogues.speaker: TONY AND MARSHA
dialogues.text: (in unison) Same difference. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: TONY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you scared of me?

dialogues.speaker: MARSHA
dialogues.text: No. But I was.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: You're very pretty.

dialogues.speaker: MARSHA
dialogues.text: (softly) Thanks. They look at each other. Smile.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Can I kiss you? She nods. He kisses her tentatively. Then tenderly. Marsha pushes away.

dialogues.speaker: TONY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: MARSHA
dialogues.text: Nothing. Marsha fishes into her pants pocket.

dialogues.speaker: MARSHA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If we're gonna make love, you've gotta wear one of these.  She pulls out a wrapped condom. Tony reacts. Then:

dialogues.speaker: TONY

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: staring. Then crossing to Lilly, who sits in her beach recliner, r European travel magazine. In the b.g. Bobby and Riff eat fish and creamed corn.

dialogues.text: Lilly- Let's do the blindfold game together. Lilly frowns.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: I've got some. Angela smiles. Some would say angelically.

dialogues.speaker: C.U.
dialogues.text: blindfolded, walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angela leads the blindfolded and tied Lilly. As they talk, Angela leads Lilly in the direction of the trench behind the dining hall.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: Are you planning a trip soon?

dialogues.speaker: LILLY
dialogues.text: Yes. Herman and I are going to Europe. It'll be very expensive, but like Herman says, "we're worth it."

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: You have cockroaches in the pantry. And I think I sawa mouse.

dialogues.speaker: LILLY
dialogues.text: Really? We'll have to do something about that.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: Why do you bury your trash?

dialogues.speaker: LILLY
dialogues.text: Because garbage companies charge an arm and a leg.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: They're not that expensive.

dialogues.speaker: LILLY
dialogues.text: Every penny counts. It hasn't been easy taking this place over, let me tell you. Nobody wants to go to a camp where everyone's been slaughtered. They arrive at the garbage pit, with Lilly directly in fr it.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: Have you ordered your tickets to Europe yet?

dialogues.speaker: LILLY
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: Good. Your trip's been canceled. Angela shoves Lilly into the pit. Only Lilly's head is a ground. Angela crosses to the shovel as Lilly struggles to get ou

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: No they won't. They'll be suffocated soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angela, ignoring LILLY'S SCREAMS, SINGS while burying Lil her head.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: (singing) Oh, I'm a Happy Camper! I love the summer sun, I love the trees and forests, I'm always having fun! Oh, I'm a Happy Camper! I love the clear blue sky, And with the Grace of God, I'll camp until I die! Lilly, except for her head, is completely buried.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Lilly. She begins to exit.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: By the way, your husband fools around. Lilly, confused and frightened, yells at the exiting Ange

dialogues.speaker: LILLY
dialogues.text: you can't leave me here! Come back! You're in big trouble No answer.

dialogues.speaker: LILLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You little shit! Come back here  right now! Nothing.

dialogues.text: Did you hear me? GET ME OUT OF

dialogues.speaker: HERE

dialogues.text: Angela, pushing a large gas-powered lawnmower. Heading straight towards Lilly's head.

dialogues.speaker: LILLY
dialogues.text: Realizing.

dialogues.text: approaching.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: calmly pushing the mower.

dialogues.text: as the lawnmower quickly approaches.

dialogues.text: as Angela lifts the mower up so that the blades will atta Lilly's face.

dialogues.speaker: THE MOWER'S BLADES
dialogues.text: turning rapidly.

dialogues.speaker: C.U.
dialogues.text: A pair of hands reach around and cover her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Guess who?

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: Bobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angela sits under a tree. Bobby takes his hands away from face. He looks freshly groomed.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Yeah. How'd you know? He kisses her on the head. Angela gets up. Angela points to the tree.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Stand in front of the tree. Be does. On the cround next to the tree are two pieces of One is about three feet long. The other rope is wound in with one end trailing away from the tree. Angela takes the short piece of rope and ties Bobby's fee against the tree.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So you like to be tied up, huh? Bobby blushes.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Yeah. But don't tell anybody, okay? If the wrong person found out, I could lose an election someday.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: My lips are sealed. Put your hands behind the tree.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Shouldn't I take my clothes off first?

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: No. It's more fun like this. He complies. Angela takes the end of the coiled rope and hands behind the tree.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Wow. This is like something in a dirty magazine. Wouldn't that be cool? Reading about this?

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: It's more fun to live it.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Yeah. He closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I really appreciate this. It's not like I don't respect you or anything. I do. I think you're really a neat person. He opens his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: When do we screw?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby looks around. No Angela. Turning around, he sees th Angela is about to enter Herman and Lilly's Jeep parked n

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Whaddya doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as she climbs in) Thank the Lord there will be one less idiot in politics. SHE GUNS THE MOTOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angela speeds away in the Jeep. As she does, we see that tied to the Jeep's hitch. The very same rope that leads t coil ... and to Bobby.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Hey - The coil of rope quickly starts unraveling. Bobby notices

dialogues.speaker: NOI
dialogues.text: Bobby tries to quickly untie himself. But it's no use. The coil of rope soon disappears. The taut rope now yanks Bobby's arms back.

dialogues.text: Bobby's arms RIP out of their sockets.

dialogues.speaker: A CENTERFOLD OF A BEAUTIFUL MODEL.
dialogues.text: A tape cassette is flung on top of the picture.

dialogues.speaker: RIFF
dialogues.text: Riff, noticing, picks it up. Studies it a moment. Then he and ejects the cassette PLAYING in his beat box. Be inser the.new one. Hits the play button.

dialogues.text: FROM SOMEONE'S VOICE. Then:

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA'S VOICE ON THE TAPE
dialogues.text: (rapping) Angels are pretty, Angels can fly, And here's an angel That can make you die. You've got no style, You've got no flair, All you do Is fight and swear. So say your prayers And make amends, Cause your life story Is about to end. Silence.

dialogues.text: What? The tent suddenly collapses around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can see the outline of Riff's body as he crawls to the

dialogues.speaker: RIFF
dialogues.text: (very angry) Fuckheads! I'll get you! His right hand reaches out.

dialogues.speaker: RIFF'S HAND
dialogues.text: as a tent stake is swiftly driven through it. Riff SCREAMS

dialogues.text: Angela, towering over the collapsed tent, drives another into the tent where Riff's back arches out. Blood seeps through the cloth as Riff writhes and SCREAMS doesn't let up until his SCREAMS DIE OUT. Silence. Angela gives the stake one last pound for good luck. Then calmly crosses over to her tent and enters. Finally ready good night's sleep.

dialogues.speaker: MARSHA AND TONY
dialogues.text: kissing by the side of a tent. Marsha looks up. Sees:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: glaring at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marsha startled, stops kissing Tony. Tony, confused, look also sees Angela. Angela carries her sleeping bag and sui

dialogues.text: (to Angela) Hello. Ignoring him, Angela crosses to Barney, who plays frisbee Greg and Anita. Tony and Marsha curious, get up and follo behind.

dialogues.text: (to Angela) Can we do something for you?

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: Yeah. Herman wants me to be in this group. I'm supposed to switch. With Marsha. THE CAMPERS VOICE THEIR SURPRISE AND DISAPPOINTMENT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angela silently leads the way as Barney and Marsha walk b her. They walk down a very narrow path next to the edge o hill.

dialogues.speaker: MARSHA
dialogues.text: Our group was so good, too.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Maybe, if I talk with Herman, you can stay. But it's not my camp, so we've got to do what he wants. Besides, we're all getting together tomorrow anyway .

dialogues.speaker: MARSHA
dialogues.text: I know. But even so. Tonight was going to be special.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With us? Or with Tony? Marsha, embarrassed, LAUGHS. Angela, jealous and angry, turns and looks at Marsha. Marhsa looks at her and smiles. Then notices:

dialogues.speaker: MARSHA
dialogues.text: Maria, look out - Too late. Anaela trips over a root in the path. Marsha rushes over side.

dialogues.speaker: MARSHA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you all right? Angela tries not to cry.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: It hurts. Marsha, concerned, turns toward Barney.

dialogues.speaker: MARSHA
dialogues.text: What'1ll we do?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Cut it off.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: (surprised) I'm joking.

dialogues.speaker: A FIRST AID KIT ATTACHED TO THE WALL
dialogues.text: Mostly empty. A hand reaches for an ace bandage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Barney takes the bandage and crosses to Angela, sittin table with her shoe off. Marsha stands next to her, holdi hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're lucky we've got this. The first aid kit was pretty empty.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: What a surprise. Barney starts bandaging the ankle.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: It's not too bad. You'll just have to stay off of it as much as possible. Marsha strokes Anaela's hair.

dialogues.speaker: MARSHA
dialogues.text: Feel better?

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: Yeah. Thanks a lot. I mean it. Marsha smiles. Maria's a little strange. But she's okay.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: I'd better go find Herman.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: How well do you know him?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Not very well.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: Good. Cause he's a terrible counselor. So's Lilly.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: They're not so bad.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: They eat steak while we eat fish. He fornicates with the campers. And Lilly's so lazy, she doesn't do anything. Just sits all day and sunbathes.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: I have eyes.  Beat.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Did Herman really want Marsha to switch with you, or did you just make that up? Pause.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: I made it up. I want to be with you guys.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Sorry, Maria. We've got to stick to the rules. You should get back to Herman.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: But I don't want to.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: It's only for another day. Come on. We'll help you walk there. They help her off the table.

dialogues.speaker: MARSHA
dialogues.text: Does Lilly really sunbathe all day?

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: Yeah. In fact, she's out in the back right now.

dialogues.speaker: MARSHA
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: Go look for yourself. But I'm warning you, it's not a pretty sight. MARSHA GIGGLES.

dialogues.speaker: MARSHA
dialogues.text: (to Barney) Can 1?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Go ahead. But don't laugh in her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't! Marsha exits towards the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marsha looks through the window, but can't see anything. opens the door and enters into the back area. She turns to the garbage pit. Nothing. Disappointed she turns back. Spots something.

dialogues.speaker: MARSHA'S P.
dialogues.text: facing away from her.

dialogues.speaker: MARSHA
dialogues.text: as she smiles and creeps toward the chair. Crossing almos it, she peeks over the edge.

dialogues.speaker: MARSHA'S P.0O.V.
dialogues.text: lying on the chair. Covered with dirt and crawling with r

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marsha 0.S. SCREAMING carries into the hall. Barney runs to the kitchen area as Marsha stumbles in, ho crying, speechless.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: What's wrong? Marsha points in the direction of the back door. Barney exits toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: (to Marsha) It seems everytime I go to camp, somebody loses their head. Marsha stares at Angela.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I knew a girl last year that reminds me of you. Her name was Molly. She was really nice. Too bad she's dead. Barney, 0.S., SHOUTS TO MARSHA.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Marsha get out of herel Run to the highway!

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: (hurt) No! Stay. Marsha in shock, doesn't move. Barney re-enters.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: (to Marsha)

dialogues.speaker: GET OUT OF HERE
dialogues.text: Marsha runs out the back. Barney turns to Angela. Angela GIGGLES.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: When you get mad you look just like your son. Barney picks up a folding chair and starts crossing slowl towards Angela. He will kill her, or die trying. But he w

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: (calmly) How many have you killed this time?

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: I don't know. Lots. But I had no choice. They deserved it.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: You gonna kill me, too? Angela nods. He keeps advancing.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So how you gonna do it? A knife? A drill? A chainsaw? Angela says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire? Acid? or maybe you're going to boil me in water like you did that cook seven years ago. Come on, Angela. What's it gonna be? Silence. Then:

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: A gun. She produces Riff's gun from behind her back and FIRES.

dialogues.speaker: C.U.
dialogues.text: as the bullet hits him squarely in the forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Angela fires the remaining five rounds into Barney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marsha terrified and crying, runs down the road. SFX: A CAR ENGINE IN THE DISTANCE. Marsha turns around to see Barney's Mustang coming from c She stops. Then sees as the car gets closer:

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: She runs off the road into the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angela veers the Mustang off the road and follows Marsha woods. Running over small trees and bushes, the Mustang soon cat  to Marsha almost pinning her against a tree. Marsha starts crying uncontrollably. Angela gets out of the car and crosses to Marsha

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: We're gonna have so much fun together. Just wait. Angela strokes Marsha's hair. Horrified, Marsha pulls awa Angela reacts.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don't make me hurt you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony, Anita and Greg, sit in front of a tent. Tony stands

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I think we should go look for them.

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: Me, too.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: But Barney told us to wait. Maybe it's some kind of a test.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: They left three hours ago, man.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Hello. They turn.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: at the edge of camp. She crosses with a slight limp over group.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: Barney wants to see all of us at the main camp. Marsha's there, too. We're supposed to play a trust game together.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Where have you guys been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a long story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg, Tony and Anita stand next to each other in front of cabins. Tony and Greg s inner legs and arms have already tied together with rope; their arms tied behind their bac and Anitta's inner arms have also been tied together behi backs. Angela finishes tying Tony and Anita's inner legs as they talk.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: (to Angela) How come you don't have to be tied up?

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: Cause Barney said so.

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: When's he getting here?

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: I told you. Anytime now.

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: This is bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: Don't swear. It'll be fun.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Says your mama. Angela finishes tying them up.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: Good. All set. She crosses to a nearby tree. A rope hangs from the tree, a low branch. Angela looks o.s.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: Here comes Barney now. The others look o.s.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: I thought I saw him. Never mind. Angela turns in the opposite direction.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is that him? They turn. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: Nope. Just my eyes playing tricks on me, I guess. She takes a knife out of her back pocket, then looks up.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh. There he is. She cuts the rope with the knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barney's bloody body, tied to the rope, falls from the tr hangs in front of them. Greg, Tony and Anita SCREAM.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: Barney! Thanks for dropping in. She turns to the group.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Time to play. The object of this game is to stay alive. The rules are simple. Marsha is in one of the three cabins before you. Is she in Cabin Number One I Cabin Number Two, or Cabin Number Three? You have exactly two minutes to find out. If you try to run away, I'll kill you. if you don't find her, I'll kill you. And if you try to hurt me in anyway, I'll kill you. Any questions? The three, terrified, say nothing.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fine. Good luck!  She looks at her watch.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: On your mark ... get set ... go! They don't move. Angela crosses to them, brandishing her

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You think I'm joking? She slashes the knife across Greg's cheek. Blood starts s through the cut.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm dead serious. And you've just lost fifteen seconds.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: She'll kill us! Let's go! Greg, Tony and Anita struggle to the first cabin, climb t stairs and enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shining their flashlight in the dark cabin, the three qui cross to a form under the covers of one of the beds.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Marsha! Greg pulls back the cover. Jan. Burnt to a crisp. They react, and turn to the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: TONY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Marsha!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter and see:

dialogues.speaker: CINDY'S BODY
dialogues.text: propped up on the bathroom counter. Her skull smashed; he covered in blood. Hysterical, they exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three head for the counselor's room. They open the d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lying against the wall. Like Jan, burnt. Unlike Jan, his blown off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angela checks her watch as the three exit the cabin and h the second cabin.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: A minute and a half to go! They quickly enter the second cabin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three enter and almost stumble over Snowboy's torched laying on the floor. Anita SCREAMS. They open the counselor's door. Riff, hanging from above the door, swings down in front o

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: I can't take it! We've gotta stop!

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: No! They move on to the bathroom. A severed arm hangs from th doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter to find another severed arm on the floor. Bobb bloody, armless body is propped up in the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They exit. All three have gone over the edge. They head for the third cabin: Angela's old cabin from la

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: Two down. One to go. You've got forty seconds left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg, Tony, and Anita enter. The room is empty.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Marsha! Silence. Then, from the counselor's room, they HEAR CRYIN

dialogues.speaker: TONY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Marsha! They rush to the door. Just as they open it:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the middle of the room. Her arms and legs hogtied with Berman's burnt corpse leans against one side of her. Lill decapitated cadaver leans against the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hatchet and a double-edged ax, tied to ropes and weight bricks, swiftly swing down from the top of the doorway. The ax hits Anita in her chest. The hatchet hits Greg in his abdomen. Blood gushes from their wounds. Tony and Marsha horrified beyond belief, react. Dying, their bodies slump. Tony struggles to support thei weight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angela enters.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: Congratulations. You made it. With seven seconds to go. You're both nice kids. If you ask me, the other two were kinda boring.  She turns.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I've got to be going. The phone lines have been cut. But there's a pay phone at a little store about three miles from here. She crosses to the cabin door. Then turns back to Tony.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I have to admit, I had a crush on you. But you and Marsha look good together. And as my aunt always said, "there's plenty of fish in the sea." Bye. She exits. Tony drops down to Marsha.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Marsha - But Marsha doesn't hear him. With all her strength, she l hogtied legs and arms up in the air. Then brings them swiftly down on the double-edged ax wedg Anita's body. The ropes slice in two.

dialogues.speaker: THE BACK OF ANGELA
dialogues.text: as she walks toward the Jeep. SFX: A WOMAN SCREAMING. Angela turns around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCREAMING AT THE TOP OF HER LUNGS and brandishing the ax, runs straight towards Angela.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angela, terrified, runs with all her might. But her ankle slows her down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marsha chases Angela. Angela runs faster. Angela falls, but somehow manages to and run again. Marsha catches up and swings the ax at Angela. She misses Angela tries to get away, but Marsha gives the ax another and hits Angela in the arm. The ax falls. Angela, holding her arm, falls to the ground. Marsha goes for the ax. Angela trips her. Angela, with her knife, stabs Marsha across the leg. She tries to stab her again, but Marsha grabs the knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marsha still SCREAMING, stabs Angela repeatedly in the to

dialogues.speaker: TONY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Stop it, Marsha! Stop it! Marsha looks up. She breaks down, CRYING BITTERLY.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: (whispering) You try to be nice to someone, and look what happens. Her eyes close.

dialogues.speaker: A POLICE CAR
dialogues.text: Speeding down the road, SIREN BLARING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A POLICEMAN drives. Tony and Marsha sit in the back. Both bandaged.  Silence, then Tony turns to Marsha.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: (tenderly) You okay? Marsha nods.

dialogues.speaker: TONY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You sure?

dialogues.speaker: MARSHA
dialogues.text: (softly) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I love you so much. Marsha weakly smiles. He kisses her an the forehead.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Everything's gonna be fine. I'll move to Ohio. We can be together forever. We'll get married.

dialogues.speaker: MARSHA
dialogues.text: Tony -

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: MARSHA
dialogues.text: I kinda already have a boyfriend. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: MARCIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But you can always visit. On Tony's reaction:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ambulance, with lights and SIREN, speeds down the road

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angela, eyes closed, lies on a gurney. She is covered in bandages. An I.V. is connected to her arm. A FAT PARAMEDI watches her on one side, A REDNECK POLICEMAN on the other STERN-LOOKING MAN drives.

dialogues.speaker: PARAMEDIC
dialogues.text: She's still alive.

dialogues.speaker: POLICEMAN
dialogues.text: (to paramedic) Let's kill her. Nobody'1l know.

dialogues.speaker: PARAMEDIC
dialogues.text: I dunno...

dialogues.speaker: POLICEMAN
dialogues.text: Come on. She doesn't deserve to live.

dialogues.speaker: PARAMEDIC
dialogues.text: It'd be easy to do. Angela's eyes open.

dialogues.speaker: POLICEMAN
dialogues.text: It'd put a stop to all of this. It's gotta end sometime.

dialogues.speaker: THE HYPO IN ANGELA'S ARM
dialogues.text: as Angela rips it out.

dialogues.speaker: THE POLICEMAN
dialogues.text: as Angela stabs the policeman in the heart with the hypo.

dialogues.speaker: C.U.
dialogues.text: as the hypo is stabbed deep into his eye. Then into his neck.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: laying back down on the gurney.

dialogues.speaker: AMBULANCE DRIVER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey! What's happening back there?

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: (whispering) Just taking care of business. She smiles. And shuts her eyes. FADE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA'S VOICE
dialogues.text: (rapping) Angels are pretty, Angels can fly, And here's an angel That can make you die. You've got no style, You've got no flair, All you do Is fight and swear. So say your prayers, And make amends, Cause your life story Is about to end.

dialogues.speaker: FADE OUT.
